description: In this unusual brownie recipe from the Boston pastry chef Rick Katz, half of the recipe’s eggs and sugar are mixed in with the chocolate, while the other half are beaten until they double in volume and are as light as sponge Whipping the eggs creates the surprisingly creamy, soft and definitively fudgy texture.
title: Rick Katz’s Brownies for Julia Child
title_page: Rick Katz’s Brownies for Julia Child Recipe - NYT Cooking
text:
In this unusual brownie recipe from the Boston pastry chef Rick Katz, half of the recipe’s eggs and sugar are mixed in with the chocolate, while the other half are beaten until they double in volume and are as light as sponge. Whipping the eggs creates the surprisingly creamy, soft and definitively fudgy texture.
Featured in: The Baker's Apprentice: Brownies.
